bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to John B. Moore, October 22, 1898
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 9, Consular Series, Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Lib. Oct. 22, 1898.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D 25 NOV '98 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Owen L. W. Smith, to Hon. J. B. Moore, Asstistant Secretary of State, Wasington.

Subject: The nomination of William F. Hutchison, a British subject, of Cape Coast, Gold Coast Colony, Africa; to be United States Commercial Agent, at Cape Coast Castle, in lien of the late George E. Eminsang Esq. deceased.
#12 of Nov 15 aerdes 24 Oly to investigate in shiping
No. 9 Consular Series. Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Lib. Oct 22, 1898.
Hon. J. B. Moore, Assistant Secretary of State; Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to say that in answer to a letter of July 8, 1898, from J. E. Eminsang Esq. of Almina Gold Coast Colony, Africa, informing me of the death of his father George E. Eminsang Esq., late United States, Commercial Agent, at Cape Coast Castle, and in the same letter petitioning to be appointed his fathers' successor, as United States Commercial Agent, at Cape Coast Castle,

I did on the 11th day of August 1898, appoint the said J. E. Eminsang Esq., temporarily; United States Commercial Agent at the Cape Coast Castle, Agency, with a request that I hear from him at an early date. See reply to my request and appointment, I have not, yet heard from him, I therefore, think him either too slow or careless to fill so responsible position, and de herewith Lake pleasure in nominating William F. Hutchison Esq., a British subject of Cape Coast, Gold Coast Colony, Africa; a gentleman who is very highly recommended to me, as a man of fine parts, possessed of business qualities qualities to fit him for the position of United States

Commercial Agent, at Cape Coast Castle. I therefore, nominate Mr. William F. Hutchison, for the position and hope the nomination may so meet your approval, as to insane an early return of the blank oath of office, accompanied with a blank official bond.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant, Owen L. W. Smith
Inclosure, A letter from William F Hutchison Cape Coast
15 Guilford Street Russell W. C. 30th September 1898.
His Excellency Owen L. W. Smith Minister Resident and Consul-General U. S. A. Monrovia

Dear Sir, Your esteemed favor of the 18th August 1898 has been forwarded to me here. Mr. G. E. Eminsang died since I left the Gold Coast for this country but I have been informed of this oath by my friends residing in the same town, and by the notice in the Treat and English Press.
Mr J. E. Eminsang, your correspondent, is the son of the late Mr. G. E. Eminsang, and is a youth of good character, but otherwise I know nothing of him.
I am willing to accept the appointment of United States Consular Agent for the Gold Coast Colony. I presume that the enjoyed by the late Mr Eminsang will be continued to me.
I have the honor to be Sir, your obedient servant
Please address reply to me at Cape Coast to which place I shall shortly return.
